alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Laramie County through 500 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Whitaker to 10 miles northwest of Burns to near Hillsdale to near Carpenter. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Burns, Hillsdale, Meriden Rest Area, Gun Barrel, Carpenter and Ranchettes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 368 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County
